collation.p: 12 quires of mostly 16 leaves each. Of the last quire only three leaves have been used. Small vertical catchwords at the end of quires.

scriptDesc.scriptNote: Sefardi semi-cursive script of the 15th century. Yeshu῾ah ben David ha-Kohen: inscribed with his name in the colophon, folio 178r.

binding.p: Post-1600. Brown leather, brown tooled. Spine: 'Ibn Rashid. Comment. In Aristoteles Libros De Auditu. Hebr. Mus. Brit. Jure Emptionis. 17,051 Plut.'

history.provenance: Acquisition: Purchased by the British Museum from Thomas Rodd the younger (b. 1796, d. 1849), London bookseller, at Macdonald's sale, lot 158, 23 October 1847: inscribed, folio [182v] (fse004v).
